title: fastqc
description: Fastqc component, please see https://www.bioinformatics.babraham.ac.uk/projects/fastqc/. This component can take one or more files (by means of shell globbing) or a complete directory.

Dataset input.title: Dataset input
Dataset input.description: Dataset input using nf-tower "dataset" or "data explorer". Allows for the input of multiple         parameter sets to initialise a Nextflow channel.

param_list.description: Dataset input can either be a list of maps, a csv file, a json file, a yaml file, or simply a yaml                 blob. The names of the input fields (e.g. csv columns, json keys) need to be an exact match with the workflow input parameters.

mode.description: Type: `string`, default: `files`, choices: ``files`, `dir``. The mode in which the component works
mode.help_text: Type: `string`, default: `files`, choices: ``files`, `dir``. The mode in which the component works. Can be either files or dir.

input.description: Type: `file`, required, example: `fastq_dir`. Directory containing input fastq files
input.help_text: Type: `file`, required, example: `fastq_dir`. Directory containing input fastq files.

output.description: Type: `file`, required, default: `$id.$key.output.output`, example: `qc`. Output directory to write reports to
output.help_text: Type: `file`, required, default: `$id.$key.output.output`, example: `qc`. Output directory to write reports to.

threads.description: Type: `integer`. Specifies the number of files which can be processed simultaneously
threads.help_text:
Type: `integer`. Specifies the number of files which can be processed simultaneously. Each thread will be allocated 250MB of
memory.

nextflow input-output arguments.title: Nextflow input-output arguments
nextflow input-output arguments.description: Input/output parameters for Nextflow itself. Please note that both publishDir and publish_dir are supported but at least one has to be configured.

publish_dir.description: Type: `string`, required, example: `output/`. Path to an output directory
publish_dir.help_text: Type: `string`, required, example: `output/`. Path to an output directory.
